results.title: Antarctic adventure
results.brief_description: A record of the New Zealand Expedition to Antarctica during the International Geophysical Year. Shows the party led by Sir Edmund Hillary setting out in the N.Z. Navy Vessel “Endeavour”. Follows their progress through the Antarctic Ocean to Ross Island, and the establishment of Antarctic bases in cooperation with the American party.

results.title: The Ant and the grasshopper
results.brief_description: This animated fable points out the familiar moral that we can’t play all the time but must work and save for a time of need. While all the ants labor industriously to provide for the coming winter, the grasshopper rests in the summer sun. But when winter comest, the grasshopper finds it difficult to live and it is the ants turn to sing and play. Suitable for lower and middle primary levels.

results.title: Answering the child's 'why'
results.brief_description: This film brings to light important aspects of the period when the child begins to ask questions. Our answers to their questions go far toward shaping their development as participants in our democratic society. How we answer these questions, therefore, is of vital importance. The film dramatizes true-to-life situations in which youngsters meet with positive or negative attitudes toward their questions and suggests the resulting effects on their personalities.

results.title: The Answer is understanding
results.creator_credit: Associated Film Consultants and National Institute of Mental Health (U.S.)
results.brief_description: Illustrates some of the difficulties involved in dealing with the problems of drug addiction. Examines the growing of opium in the Middle East, the history of drug use, the complex social patterns of drug use, the variety of pressures towards drug dependence in urban life, and the difficulty of preventing drugs from entering the United States. Elements of the drug problem in many overseas countries are also examined.

results.title: Ansel Adams: photographer
results.creator_credit: David Myers and Larry Dawson Productions
results.brief_description: The work and philosophy of Ansel Adams, a gifted musician, writer and teacher as well as photographer, for which he is best known. A professional photographer must have an endless amount of equipment; cameras, lenses, tripods, light meters etc. Adams is seen shooting a beach scene and later in the dark room creating a picture. His work as an industrial photographer is also illustrated. Music played by Ansel Adams. Curator - The George Eastman House.

results.title: Another viewpoint
results.brief_description: Intended for prospective migrants to Australia from Europe. Shows the reactions and impressions of various immigrants. It is emphasised that Australia is a predominantly suburban society.

results.title: Another sunny day in Western Australia
results.creator_credit: Ian Dunlop, Eric Thompson and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Shows outdoor activities occurring on a typical sunny day in Perth, Western Australia. The emphasis is on sporting activities; bowling, athletics, sailing, surfing, cycling and trampolining.

results.title: Another side of the forest = L'Autre visage de la foret
results.creator_credit: Raoul Fox, Strowan Robertson, Bill Brind, Colin Low and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A fascinating look at developments that aim to protect and conserve Canada’s vast forest reserves. Some of the experiments shown, both in laboratories and in the field include turning a Newfoundland bog into woodland, propagating British Columbia seedlings to withstand mechanical planting, inoculating Ontario elms against bark beetle and devising ways to control fire.
results.title_for_label: Another side of the forest = L’Autre visage de la foret

results.title: Another day of healing
results.creator_credit: Graham Bye, Leon Bram, Associated World and Film Partnership (Vic.)
results.brief_description: In an attempt to cater for the medical needs of over 200,000 people annually, the Austin Hospital works twenty-four hours a day. The film shows the activities of all the departments of the Hospital and briefly tells some of its history. Written by John Hindle.

results.title: Another day
results.creator_credit: Jennie Blackwood, Anti Cancer Council and Zanthus Films
results.brief_description: Views of a number of people who have suffered from cancer leading normal happy lives. Stresses the importance of seeking medical advice and aid at the first suspicion that one has contracted the disease.
